nodejs.notes: Before version 13.0.0, only the locale data for en-US is available by default. See the Collator() constructor for more details.

Before version 13.0.0, only the locale data for en-US is available by default. When other locales are specified, the Collator instance silently falls back to en-US. To make full ICU (locale) data available before version 13, see Node.js documentation on the --with-intl option and how to provide the data.

chrome.notes: Before version 71, formatToParts() returned an object with an incorrectly cased type key of dayperiod. Version 71 and later use the specification defined dayPeriod. See Chromium bug 865351.

edge.notes: Before Edge 18, numbers are rounded to 15 decimal digits. For example, new Intl.NumberFormat('en-US').format(1000000000000005) returns "1,000,000,000,000,010".

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer 11, numbers are rounded to 15 decimal digits. For example, new Intl.NumberFormat('en-US').format(1000000000000005) returns "1,000,000,000,000,010".
